Saved
How can I be saved?

"For God so loved the world that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him shall not perish but have eternal life. For God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but to save the world through him." John 3:16-17

God loves you and created you to be in relationship with Him. Though sin separates us from God, He did not want to see us perish. God sent His one and only Son, Jesus Christ, to die on the cross. If you believe this, you are saved. You will experience eternal life with Jesus Christ. Eternal life is not something that you can earn, nor does it require works; Jesus tells us that it requires believing in him.

No one is perfect, just look around. All of us are in need of Jesus, and God knew that when he sent Jesus to die on the cross. Have you admitted this? If so, have you told people about it? Do it. If you haven't put your faith in God, ask someone who has about it. Lord, I admit that I'm a sinner. I often put my own motives and plans ahead of what you have for me. I trust that you sent Jesus to die on the cross, saving me from my sin. Please forgive me when I sin and help me to be more like you. Amen
How can I help others be saved?
"but you will receive power when the Holy Spirit comes on you; and you will be my witnesses in Jerusalem, and in all Judea and Samaria, and to the ends of the earth." Acts 1:8

Jesus tells his disciples to be witnesses throughout every part of the earth. To be a witness involves having personal knowledge of something. The disciples had spent three years with Jesus before his death on the cross; they were instructed to go and teach others about him. Jesus also tells the disciples that the Holy Spirit will give them power. This is true for you as well – the Holy Spirit will be with you as you go and share the good news of Christ.

Think about what it takes to be a witness. You will need to spend time with God, studying his Word, worshiping, praying, and being still. You will experience first-hand the power and love of Christ. Once you have the personal experience, you can tell others about Christ. Remember, you can't make someone believe something, but you can tell others about Christ and be an example in your daily life. While this may be a scary thing to do, the Holy Spirit is in you and will not leave you. Eternal life is a serious matter. Ask God to use you in sharing him with your friends and family.
I'm saved. Now what?

"In the same way, count yourselves dead to sin but alive to God in Christ Jesus. Therefore do not let sin reign in your mortal body so that you obey its evil desires. Do not offer the parts of your body to sin, as instruments of wickedness, but rather offer yourselves to God, as those who have been brought from death to life; and offer the parts of your body to him as instruments of righteousness. For sin shall not be your master, because you are not under law, but under grace." Romans 6:11-14

Paul tells us that once we are Christians, we are not to keep sinning as before. With Christ on your side, you have the Holy Spirit's power to break free of being enslaved to sin. Instead of following sinful temptations and behavior, you are to give your life to doing what's right. God knows that you will still sin, so he gives you grace, but that doesn't give you permission to keep sinning. God wants you to live a holy life, set apart for him.

When you get a new phone, how do you treat it? Are you careful not to drop it? Spill water on it? Or do you treat it like an old toy, shoving it under your bed and forgetting about it? In the same way, once you are a Christian, you have a new life in Christ. You are to devote yourself to what's right and good. Sinful habits often don't go away overnight, but with the help of the Holy Spirit and someone to keep you accountable, you can break old habits and the things that keep you from God. Ask God to help you grow in him, do what's right and put away the old, sinful self.
Once I'm saved, can I become unsaved?
"My sheep listen to my voice; I know them, and they follow me. I give them eternal life, and they shall never perish; no one can snatch them out of my hand." John 10:27-28

If you have placed an authentic faith in God, you are one of his sheep. He knows you and has given you eternal life. You listen to him and follow him. No one can snatch you out of his hand. No one. The power of Christ's blood is more powerful than any human being.

Out of all the things you own, your relationship with God is one of the only things that can't be taken away from you. Think about what makes a relationship healthy. Do things like spending time with someone, talking, listening, laughing, or crying come to mind? Work on your relationship with God in the same way you build relationships with friends and family. Once you put your faith in God, you can't become unsaved. Pray for people in your life to help you grow in your faith. Obstacles will come, but nothing can overpower God. Pray for wisdom and for God's strength to shine through you.
What is "saved"?
"For the wages of sin is death, but the gift of God is eternal life in Christ Jesus our Lord." Romans 6:23

When Adam disobeyed what God told him, sin entered the world, causing the relationship between God and man to be broken. To be "saved" means you have put your faith in God, reconciling the broken relationship with Him. It means to be saved from eternity without God.

Think about your words, your actions, your thoughts. What are things that cause you to need to be saved? Are they things that you could truly overcome by yourself in your own strength, or do you need a Savior, someone to save you from your sin? Lord, thank you for coming to earth to save me from eternity without you. Please forgive my sins and show me areas of my life that I need to clean up. Help me to step out of the way and allow you to work in my life.
Self Control
What if I don't have any self-control?
"…to obey is better than sacrifice…" 1 Samuel 15:22

The Bible is filled with stories of men who didn't have a whole lot of self-control: Samson, David, Cain, Noah, even Abraham. Though these guys are credited to be men of God, they ended up falling short in certain areas of their lives due to their sins for which they could not control. 1 John tells us that when sin is full grown, it leads to death. The word of God says it is DEATH. Eventually, when not dealt with, sin will kill you. It's easy to say now that porn or lying or a little stealing won't hurt. But eventually it can become a real problem that will lead you down a road you don't want travel.

Obey God and walk away from sin. Write down all the sins in your life that are caused by a lack of self-control. The list gets long. Use some of the applications in the other questions to help you get a heads up on self-control. God is the ultimate source of strength and endurance. He wants you to succeed. Ask him to help you master your will.
What is self-control?
"Therefore, prepare your minds for action; be self-controlled, set your hope fully on the grace to be given you when Jesus Christ is revealed." 1 Peter 1:13

The biblical idea of self-control comes from the Greek word "KRATOS" which means "strength." The idea is that God strengthens you to control your will. Take hold over your desires and wants and don't let them rule over you. With The Spirit of God in you, no sin can master you and you now have the power in you that raised Christ from the dead.

No man can fully change or control his will on his own. If you did not save yourself, you cannot change yourself. But Christ can. Take time today to ask God to give you the strength to control your will. Better yet, ask him to replace your will with His. God loves you and desires for you to live a "self-controlled" life. Ask for help.
What example did Jesus give of self-control?

"Again, the devil took him to a very high mountain and showed him all the kingdoms of the world and their splendor. All this I will give you," he said, "if you will bow down and worship me." Jesus said to him, "Away from me, Satan! For it is written: ‘Worship the Lord your God, and serve him only.' Then the devil left him, and the angels came and attended him. Matthew 4:8-11

Satan offered Jesus power over kingdoms of the world that were in his control and Jesus resisted him showing supernatural self-control given him by his Father in heaven. And when he did the angels came to offer him peace and comfort.

Be assured that Satan will tempt you to lose control and gosh knows what else, but stand firm in the knowledge that just like Jesus, you have authority in you through HIM to speak, "away from me Satan, for it is written to serve the Lord only". So where is it written? In the Word…the Bible…it is the sword of the Spirit and it is mighty to protect you from the evil snares of the enemy. Pray: Jesus, give me power to resist the temptations of the enemy who comes to steal, kill and destroy. You are the author of my life and in your word I will abide. Thank you for giving me power in YOU to have self-control. In your precious name, AMEN.
How do you have self-control?
"How can a young man (or woman) keep his (or her) way pure? By living according to Your word." Psalm 119:9

The Old Testament is filled with author's writing about how great God's laws are. Why? Because they understand that God's laws mean the best for them. It's not about how many you can or cannot keep. It's about trusting in God for your salvation and in His power for your obedience. His word has power and will help you fight against any temptations or desires you battle with.

Memorize numerous verses that have to do with overcoming temptation and learning self-control. And when the battle begins, use them to fight against sin. Read Psalm 119 for more insight on God's law and power. Pray for him to help you.
Why is self-control important?
"No one who is born of God will continue to sin, because God's seed remains in him; he cannot go on sinning, because he has been born of God." 1 John 3:9

Here's the deal. It is absolutely a part of God's will that you be separate from the world around you. The world gives in to all the pleasures it sees. But if you call Jesus your savior, you should only give in to His desires. His will becomes your will and you no longer live to please yourself. In doing this, you become an ambassador for the grace and power of Christ.

Write down all the things you see in the world that are caused by a lack of self-control. After that, write down all the things that are cured by self-control. Which world would you want to live in? Ask God to create a pure heart inside of you that is devoted to His will and not yours.
Sex
Is pornography bad?

"For you know what instructions we gave you by the authority of the Lord Jesus. It is God's will that you should be sanctified: that you should avoid sexual immorality; that each of you should learn to control your own body in a way that is holy and honorable, not in passionate lust like the pagans, who do not know God; and that in this matter no one should wrong or take advantage of a brother or sister. The Lord will punish all those who commit such sins, as we told you and warned you before. For God did not call us to be impure, but to live a holy life. Therefore, anyone who rejects this instruction does not reject a human being but God, the very God who gives you his Holy Spirit." 1 Thessalonians 4:2-8

Jesus said we should avoid sexual immorality, that we should strive for honor and holiness rather than give in to the lusts that make us do some really dumb stuff like take advantage of each other for sexual gain. You are called to something much greater than this, you are called to holiness! It's not like telling a friend to just hush, when you walk into these things, you are rejecting God Himself, the one who gives you the Holy Spirit!

Would you say that when you are looking at porn you are lusting? Yeah, I would too. The question posed is one that makes us feel like this isn't as bad since we aren't doing it, let's not compare sins. It's kind of like asking you if you would rather drink puss from a runny sore or a glass of warm snot from a sick hog…. yeah, um, no thanks. This is a graphic metaphor, but pornography is graphic and its images have Satanic power to trap us into bondage. Many people struggle with this addiction and it is a stronghold difficult to break. Don't even go there, for Christ came to set you free from such slavery. Ask Christ to remind you who you are in Him. Ask him to free you from any bondage or desires with porn.
How far is too far?

"Let us behave decently, as in the daytime, not in carousing and drunkenness, not in sexual immorality and debauchery, not in dissension and jealousy. Rather, clothe yourselves with the Lord Jesus Christ, and do not think about how to gratify the desires of the sinful nature." Romans 13:13-14

Be the same person in all your relationships and actions as you are when you pursue Christ. In fact, wrap yourself up with Jesus and remove yourself from having to contemplate things that will trap you…. including sexual behavior outside of marriage.

Ok, this is a question that is asking the wrong thing. You are looking for a line, i.e. "how much can I get away with and still be ok?" The truth is sexual contact shouldn't really be a destination in your relationships. Your hormones are raging out of control sometimes and there is no perceived line that will be observed. The question is one of the heart….who is at the center of yours? If indeed it is Christ, then go to Him with your concerns. Chances are very good that the idea of how far to go will be of little concern once you take it to Him. A faith that has us preferring Christ over all things snuffs ill based ideas out and sets us free. Pray to Jesus and ask Him to redirect your focus. Ask Him to be central with your relationships.
What is the big deal about sex?

"Drink water from your own cistern, running water from your own well. Should your springs overflow in the streets, your streams of water in the public squares? Let them be yours alone, never to be shared with strangers. May your fountain be blessed, and may you rejoice in the wife of your youth." Proverbs 5:15-18

Well, it is a big deal, in fact its great and encouraged the way God intended. As you read above, he even mentions enjoying it! He is talking about the confines of marriage, where it is shared between two people who will never share it with anyone else. King Solomon, the author of Proverbs, isn't talking about water, he is talking about intimacy. It's a big deal because so many things in our future marriage are linked to what we do in this area. Trust, commitment, comparisons, and safety will all be affected in the long run. Remember purity breeds intimacy.

You need to pursue wise counsel. Who in your life knows Christ well and loves you? Get some of their time and be completely honest with them about where you have been, what you have considered and the questions you have about sex. When the topic of sex comes up among your friends or "the friend", listen from where their opinion comes. There is a good chance it comes out of the desire to engage in it, rather than an opinion that comes from a God view of the subject. Pray to Jesus that he would guide and reveal to you the importance of sex in your future and why it might be important to follow God's plan for it in your life.
Why did God make sex?

Awake, north wind, and come, south wind! Blow on my garden, that its fragrance may spread abroad. Let my beloved come into his garden and taste its choice fruits. I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride; I have gathered my myrrh with my spice. I have eaten my honeycomb and my honey; I have drunk my wine and my milk. Eat, friends, and drink; drink your fill of love." Song of Solomon 4:16-5:1

Wife- I am ready, it will be awesome, it is yours and yours only for the taking! Husband- Uh huh! Woooo Hooo, now that's what I'm talking about! That was AWESOME! God- Enjoy (seriously, it is in the Bible and that's what it means)

God is the author of sex, it's that simple. It's how he chose that we would bring new life into this world, yes but let's not discount something, God intended for us to enjoy it! If we want to experience it the way he intended and without all the consequences and guilt, we just have to wait until we have found the person with whom we will promise God to honor and love the rest of our lives and then… Woo Hoo! God loves you, and sex is good in its proper place, it's the world that has twisted and perverted it. Remember fire is good and useful in a fireplace, but not on the curtains and the roof. Ask Jesus and the Holy Spirit to reveal to you the truth about sex. Ask him to give you eyes to see the lies about sex that are sold to us every day in the world.
If you are in love is it ok to have sex?
"Daughters of Jerusalem, I charge you: Do not arouse or awaken love until it so desires." Song of Solomon 8:4

This is actually taken from a hot moment before a bride and groom will share themselves with each other. She is pleading with those that follow the Lord to save themselves for this moment. This woman is experiencing the moment of giving herself to her groom and wanting that very thing for everyone else. It is something that will be defended for years and given once.

Let's be honest, "love"? You likely feel a great deal for them but if you go and read a little bit about true love in the Bible you will see that it is wrapped up in far more than making out. The likelihood of the person you are with right now being the one you marry is not good, right up there with each of us knowing we will be a singer selling out all venues and winning a Grammy since we did just sing in the school play last week… could happen, but it isn't likely. So you don't engage in what is a desire for the day. If you love them, honor them by not being tempted or even better, by not tempting them. If it is true love, time will tell and when you finally take this person as your spouse, you will have a precious gift to give that has not been given before…pure and ONLY for your one true love. Pray and ask Jesus to guide your relationship and heart. Ask him to teach you about true love.
Stressed Out
If something I'm doing is causing stress, should I just not do it?
"And the peace of God, which transcends all understanding, will guard your hearts and your minds in Christ Jesus." Philippians 4:7

This verse tells us that the peace of God goes beyond reason. His peace can cover all our worries. Those we have imagined and made worse in our minds and those that are weighing heavy on our heart. He can guard our hearts and minds with his perfect peace.

Sometimes you might think you have too much on your plate with school, sports, extra-curricular activities, relationships, parents, friends and more. HOWEVER, that doesn't mean you can just quit something if it makes life easier. You need to look at all the things in life that you are involved in and ask yourself, "Am I able to do my best at this in order to bring glory to God?" If the answer is no, what else in your life can be shifted around or dropped in order to do your best? When you don't know what to shift or drop, put your complete reliance on your Savior to give you guidance. When there is something that can be shifted or dropped, talk to your parents, pastor or mentor first before making the decision. You may not be able to see the big picture now, but everything God has placed in your life is in your best interest. Sometimes we think that everything in life is stressing us out, but it's because we don't take time to read the Word and spend time with Him. He will give us peace, unlike anything we can imagine, if we just trust and rely on Him.
How do I work well through stress?
"An angel from Heaven appeared to him and strengthened him. And being in anguish, he prayed more earnestly, and his sweat was like drops of blood falling to the ground." Luke 22:43-44

The best example we can take is from Jesus. Just hours before He was crucified for our sins, Jesus was in anguish over what he knew was about to happen to Him. How did He handle it? The Bible says he prayed so fervently that his sweat became blood. That means he broke blood vessels in His head he was praying so hard. The first thing we should always do when stressed out is turn to God in prayer. Notice what happened to Jesus when He prayed: He was comforted. Yes, He was eventually crucified to save the sins of the world, but God helped Him through it, just like he will help you.

What task is before you that you need to accomplish without the stress? God is around you and his Holy Spirit is in you, if you have accepted Him as your Savior, and is always ready to hear from you. Any time you are stressed out, and for any reason, you can just ask him to help you through it. You can say it aloud or just think it. That's the great thing about God! He is always there and He will help you!.
My parents cause me more stress than anything, what can I do about that?
"Children, obey your parents in everything, for this pleases the Lord." Colossians 3:20

The key phrase here is "in everything." For many teenagers, this seems impossible. In fact, parents seem to be the sworn enemy of their lives! You have to remember, though, that this is simply not true. The Lord placed your parents in your life for a very specific reason and when you obey them you obey Him, and this pleases the Lord. God put parents in your life to care for you and look after you. If you have Christian parents they want to raise you up to look more like Jesus. Unfortunately, some kids don't have Christian parents, but by obeying our parents we obey God and please Him. In your obedience you might just show parents lacking Christ, the Christ in you. Obedience equals blessing and blessing is NOT stressing.

The ultimate goal of our lives should be to please God. While this is very hard sometimes, and we all forget this at times, it is the very best, least stressful way to live. Jesus said He came to give us life to the fullest. This doesn't mean an easy life, but it does mean a life where we can please God and not have to worry because we know He will take care of us. A small part of that is obedience to our folks.
How come some people never get stressed out?

"Look at the birds of the air; they do not sow or reap or store away in barns, and yet your heavenly Father feeds them. Are you not much more valuable than they? Who of you by worrying can add a single hour to his life?" Matthew 6:26-27
You are much more valuable than the birds of the air and you are not adding to your life by worrying. Many reports say that worrying causes illness and takes away from your life.

Appearances are not always what they seem. You may think that some people don't get stressed, but they may have just found a way to handle it. Some practical things you can do to avoid stress are: 1. Be realistic: don't try to be perfect, no one is. 2. Get enough sleep: you might think you don't need much, but a good night's sleep keeps you going. 3. Learn to relax: find something that calms you down (listening to music, writing, dancing, jogging, etc) and make sure to find time for it. 4. Watch your attitude: your attitude can influence the way you respond to people and the way you see things. Keep it in check. All these little things can help, but the ultimate refuge is the Lord. Take into account the practical things you can do to keep stress low, but rely on the Lord first and foremost. Make sure to tell him what is bothering you and ask for His help in managing your life.
Is being stressed out a sin?
"Do not be anxious about anything, but in everything, by prayer and petition, with thanksgiving, present your requests to God." Philippians 4:6

When you are worried or stressed out, you are not totally and fully releasing your cares to the Lord. Do you believe that He is big enough and wise enough and powerful enough to handle your situation? Even though certain times in life will be busier and more stressful than others, we know that He will never give us more than we can handle. It is completely understandable to have concerns over something, but we cannot let it take hold of us. We must hand those over to the Lord with complete trust that He will handle everything in our best interest.

Sometimes the best thing to do to relieve stress is to talk about it, and who better to talk with than your Heavenly Father who knows every detail about you and your life? Spend some time releasing your cares and concerns to Him when you get worried or stressed. Jesus is the ultimate stress reliever. Find a quiet place to talk with Him about your worries. He is always available.
Stuck Up
What is wrong with being stuck up?
"The greatest among you will be the servant. For whoever exalts himself will be humbled, and whoever humbles himself will be exalted." Matthew 23:11-12

Jesus was frustrated by the Rabbi as teachers of the law. These men were responsible for spiritual guidance by teaching and preaching, but they failed to do what they taught and preached. Instead, they were full of pride and conceit. In other words they were stuck up.

The word humble means to be meek, modest or low in station, stature or rank. Jesus says he is the one who will exalt us if we position ourselves as servants. I don't know about you, but I would much rather be placed higher by HIS doing than by my doing. To be stuck up means I would be standing on the backs of people I trampled to get to that position. When our Lord exalts us, it is being stuck up in the best possible way. Jesus, I don't want to be stuck up even when others around me make me feel low if I'm not. As I release my pride, I thank you for positioning me where you want me and for knowing best. AMEN!
What do I do when friends act stuck up toward me?

"Love must be sincere. Hate what is evil; cling to what is good. Be devoted to one another brotherly love; honor one another above yourselves. Be joyful in hope, patient in affliction faithful in prayer." Romans 12:9-10, 12

Sincerity is being open and truthful. In the King James Version of the Bible it says "love without dissimulation". Dissimulation means to disguise or mask. The Lord tells us not to mask our love and to be truthful. From the first question in this topic, "what is wrong with being stuck up", we know that God wants us to be humble to one another. Acting prideful or stuck up is the opposite of love; it is evil.

If someone talks down to you or treats you as if you are not good enough then they are not a friend. Even if they wear the mask of being stuck up around certain people, but in private time with you take off the mask revealing a better image, it still does not show the brotherly love Jesus wants for you. It is being two faced. We should have one face showing our true identities in Christ. Pray for this person and ask the Lord to change their heart. If you ask HIM to arrange your friendships you will find he knows all your interests, talents, and hobbies better than you do. Before you know it, you will be surrounded with Godly friends who will love you just the way you are.
Why are people stuck up?
He said to them, "You are the ones who justify yourselves in the eyes of men, but God knows your hearts. What is highly valued among men is detestable in God's sight." Luke 16:15

Jesus was upset with the Pharisee's love for money. God knows your heart. There is no hiding what you claim to be valuable. There is no hiding pride in God's eyes. Unfortunately, people seek worth to make themselves feel more important when God alone is the one we should seek to find purpose and importance.

Stuck up is another term for pride. When we justify our actions in what we think will bring us approval before others, it is an issue of pride. And "pride goeth before a fall" says the Lord. If our intentions are to seek the approval of the world, then we fail to highly value God's intention for our lives and we are detestable in HIS sight. It is harsh, but pride and conceit deeply upset our Lord. Jesus, help me be more pleasing in your sight, putting away pride and desiring what you deem valuable. Amen.
What are the consequences of being stuck up?

"Pride goes before destruction, a haughty spirit before a fall." Proverbs 16:18
"You rebuke the arrogant, who are cursed and stray from your commandments." Psalm 119:21
"When pride comes, then comes disgrace, but with humility comes wisdom." Proverbs 11:2

As you can read pride or being stuck up is BAD and these are just a taste of many verses in the Bible that deal with being stuck up. Just a few of the potential outcomes of prideful behavior are: destruction, disgrace and rebuke from the Lord.

Being stuck up can literally kill us. Pride doesn't like to be told what to do and it entices us to make bad decisions that bring pain and punishment. Pride hides the truth, denies any problems and won't admit weakness or seek help. Pride defies all goodness and falsely positions a person outside of Christ's purpose. He died to set us free, to break us from the obstacles blinding us from his glory. If you are stuck up, you miss the awe wonder of Jesus because you put yourself above HIM. Jesus, I seek you and your glory. I put you first. Protect me from the pits of pride. Amen.
What if I prefer those things that seem "stuck up" like looking good and hanging out with people that have a certain image?
"You are looking only on the surface of things. If anyone is confident that he belongs to Christ, he should consider again that we belong to Christ just as much as he." 2 Corinthians 10:7

This passage written by Paul to the church of Corinth was meant to make the people of the church consider who they belong to, report to and consider as their source. Paul says Christ belongs to all and we should go beyond the surface.

A person only looking at outward appearances is shallow. It is fine to want to have self-respect and look nice in appearance, but when you set a standard that limits your relationships with other children of God, it is judgmental and conceited. It is liberating to be free from appearances. Be authentic, be real, and be kind. Jesus would want you to be like him. Wouldn't you prefer to be deep in Christ instead of shallow in yourself?
